summary: This document appears to be a summary or preparation notes from a November 4, 2021 WebEx meeting with Dr. Rocchio, likely in preparation for a hearing or deposition. It details Dr. Rocchio's anticipated testimony on memory principles, the concept and academic study of grooming in child sexual abuse, and her forensic practice. The document references multiple academic studies and authors on the topic.

persons.name: Dr. Rocchio
persons.context: Participated in a WebEx meeting to prepare for a hearing; will testify about generally accepted principles in memory and the concept of grooming in child sexual abuse.

persons.name: Loftus
persons.context: Cited as a source for foundational memory principles; Dr. Rocchio has attended training by Loftus.

persons.name: Duron
persons.context: Co-author of the article 'Observing Coercive Control' referenced in the discussion on grooming.

persons.name: Johnson
persons.context: Co-author of the article 'Observing Coercive Control' referenced in the discussion on grooming.

persons.name: Leclerc
persons.context: Author of a 2009 study referenced in the discussion on grooming.

persons.name: Winters
persons.context: Author of multiple cited studies on grooming, including 'Toward a Universal Definition of Childhood Grooming' (2021) and 'Validation of the Sexual Grooming Model' (2020).

persons.name: Bennett
persons.context: Co-author (with O'Donohue) of work listing 13 exemplars of grooming; Dr. Rocchio disagrees with their opinion on using grooming in forensic settings.

persons.name: O'Donohue
persons.context: Co-author (with Bennett) of work listing 13 exemplars of grooming; Dr. Rocchio disagrees with their opinion on using grooming in forensic settings.

persons.name: Dietz
persons.context: Author of 'Grooming and Seduction', referenced for the history of the term's use.

persons.name: Sandusky
persons.context: Mentioned as the case that brought the concept of grooming into the public eye.

connections.description: Dr. Rocchio has attended training by Loftus and cites her work on memory principles.
Co-authors of academic work on grooming tactics and definitions.
Dr. Rocchio references their work but disagrees with their opinion on the forensic use of grooming.

events.title: WebEx Preparation Meeting with Dr. Rocchio
events.description: A meeting held via WebEx to prepare Dr. Rocchio for an upcoming hearing or deposition, where she clarified her testimony on memory and grooming.

keyFacts: Dr. Rocchio, an expert on interpersonal violence, prepared to testify on memory principles and the academic concept of 'grooming' in child sexual abuse.

The document highlights that grooming is not a single act but a series of behaviors, is difficult to recognize in real-time, and lacks a single universally agreed-upon definition despite common tactical patterns.
The Sandusky case is cited as the pivotal moment when the concept of grooming entered widespread public awareness.

Dr. Rocchio's forensic practice involves applying grooming concepts to understand event descriptions and assess the connection between past abuse and later consequences, not to 'evaluate for grooming' directly.

The notes reference multiple academic studies and authors (Winters, Bennett & O'Donohue, Dietz, etc.) to frame the discussion on grooming, indicating the legal proceeding is engaging with scholarly literature on the topic.
